main event: A sighting of a silver-colored object, possibly a meteor or rocket, was reported near Carbondale, Illinois on February 3, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as having a blaze on top or trailing,It was moving fast at approximately 2000 feet,The sighting was made by a pilot of a private aircraft traveling at the same altitude,Limited information prevented further analysis,Initial reports did not allow for contact with the reporting pilot.
witness description: pilot of a private Cessna aircraft
